pageContent: LOGINLOGOUTHELPPrinter FriendlyPageEarthfiles, news category.Share:DiggFacebookStumbleUponCrop Formation Update as of May 21, 2000 - Part 1© 2000 by Linda Moulton Howe February 2000 Els Omellons near Las Garrigues, Barcelona Province,Spain - Two rings with circles in the middle, ancient symbol for God, appearedat different times the beginning of February 2000 in the County of Lleida. One85 feet and the other 118 feet in diameters. Crop was short, young wheat. Therings came a couple of weeks apart and were "burned" into the plants and soil,according to local reports. Samples were analyzed at a laboratory that found"whatever it waas that made the rings and circles was not an herbicide or anyother chemical agent."Photogaph © 2000 by Mas Alla.April 10, 2000 Danbury Hill Fort Near Andover, Hampshire, England - Aformation about 201 feet long in oilseed rape, or canola, resembled a nautilusshell at end of long corridor.See more details at http://www.cropcircleconnector.com.Diagram © 2000 by John Sayer.April 21, 2000 Hoeven, Holland - Ten circles in the pattern of a Christiancross in grass. Circles ranged in size from two to three meters diameter to at leastten meters diameter, according to researchers Mark Fussell and Stuart Dike atwww.cropcircleconnector.com. "It looks as if the circles occurred around 4a.m. Good Friday morning in the only field anywhere (in general area) that hadnot been sowed and planted with a crop."April 25, 2000 Farningham Near Swanley in Kent County, England - Atriangle superimposed on a ring with another smaller triangle at the big triangle'scenter and pointed the opposite way. First formation in Kent County, Englandat Farningham near Swanley in oilseed rape. Graham and Janet Tucker ofEngland's CCCS crop circle research society reported, "The formation isapproximately 70 to 80 feet in diameter. Further down the field, we viewed apossible circular grapeshot approximately 6 feet in diameter. This formation canbe clearly seen from the M20 freeway going toward London shortly before theM25 junction." See more details at www.cropcircleconnector.com. Diameter of

circle: 116 feet; outside ring width: 8 feet; inner ring width: 4 feet.Aerial photograph © 2000 by Andrew King.Photograph of smooth curve in celery-like stalk of oilseedrape (canola) laid down in Farningham, Kent formation discoveredApril 25, 2000. Photograph © 2000 by Graham Tucker.April 27, 2000 Cherhill Down, Wiltshire, England - Francine Blake of theWiltshire Crop Circle Study Group photographed this formation discovered atCherhill Down right below the obelisk monument dedicated to all the Englishlives lost in World War I. Stuart Dike of the cropcircle connector website,surveyed the formation and said "the inner triangle of standing crop had threesides of slightly different lengths: 29, 27, 26 feet respectively. The overalldiameter varied from 60 feet taken from the northeast and 57 feet from east towest. The spur facing down the field was 18 feet long and finished on theeastern tramline (tractor path)." See more details athttp://www.cropcircleconnector.com.Photograph © 2000 by Francine Blake, Wiltshire Crop Circle Study Group.
